attributes.action: Amend the Health & Social Care Act to increase focus on supporting relationships
attributes.background: Social Care inspections do not include specific reference to relationships & sex, making it possible to receive an ‘outstanding’ rating, whilst ignoring an essential part of people's lives. CQC said they cannot add mandatory questions for inspectors without amending the Health & Social Care Act
attributes.additional_details:
The questions submitted to CQC have been added as supplementary but not mandatory, meaning inspectors can currently choose not to ask them. The questions covered sexuality & relationships polices, sexual health, sexual rights and training for staff and people who use services. Read more about them https://www.choicesupport.org.uk/blog/easy-complacency-or-hard-commitment 

Social care staff are faced with difficult situations and are often untrained in this area, as it is not seen as a priority.

attributes.action: Stop arms deals with Saudi Arabia in light of Kashoggi and actions in Yemen.
attributes.background: The U.N has written a damning report of Saudi Arabia's actions in Yemen. Stating “There is little evidence of any attempt by parties to the conflict to minimize civilian casualties.” And also in light of the possible assassination of the journalist Jamal Kashoggi.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/aug/28/all-sides-in-yemen-may-be-responsible-for-war-crimes-say-un-experts

attributes.action: To make Party political Manifestos legally binding once elected.
attributes.background: Parties of all political persuasions have attempted to gain votes  by making headline gestures that they can save millions, they then renege on this pledge. This petition is trying to seek full transparency on manifestos and exactly how they will be implemented by financially backing their claims.
attributes.additional_details: Whether its student fees, the NHS, Police, immigration or universal credit. This debate should it happen will focus all political parties to sound out financial and political options; before making manifesto statements. This will show that the parties are 100% certain that they can implement and fully back up their claims. Additionally a penalty system would need to be proposed for those who do not carry out the manifesto pledge are duly summoned to public recourse and/or financial penalty.

attributes.action: Minimum of 1 England cricket Test match to be on free-to-air TV per year
attributes.background: Cricket participation levels in the United Kingdom are decreasing every year across all age groups (http://bit.ly/2MmseSJ) and this can be linked to the move in 2005 to show all England internationals exclusively on Sky Sports. It's time Test cricket was protected by Ofcom.
attributes.additional_details:
The ECB have recently dedicated to showing 2 T20 England Internationals a year from 2020 (https://ind.pn/2LUb4iV). 

However, this is not enough. It is time that some England Test matches are added to Category A of the "Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events" (https://wiki.sh/zehw) with a focus placed on Australia matches during an Ashes series.

attributes.action: Be able to register at two GP surgeries for students with two residences.
attributes.background: Students who have multiple residences during the year have the problem of when needing a prescription re-registering at GP surgeries every time they go to and from uni and home.
attributes.additional_details: For example, most women use contraception. To be able to get this, you must have a check up with the GP every three-six months to get your new pack. This causes a problem if you're at home when you are registered at your university GP and need a new pack of contraception.

attributes.action: Expand driving penalties to include the charge vehicular manslaughter
attributes.background: I think that the increase in dangerous, reckless and careless driving needs to be properly addressed. In the wrong hands a car is as lethal as a loaded gun. Death should be charged as vehicular manslaughter and life changing injuries as attempted vehicular manslaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Although courts now have to power to sentence those who cause death by dangerous driving to 14 years to life, this penalty is rarely, if ever used. I feel that if the charge included the term manslaughter, not only would the perception of motorists change, but judges would be more inclined to sentence those who have caused death or life changing injuries, whilst driving at excessive speed, whilst using a mobile device, under the influence of drink/drugs to an appropriate custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Debate providing funds to the NHS for Facial Feminisation Surgery
attributes.background: We the undersigned would like to ask the House of Commons to debate providing funding for Facial Feminisation Surgery on the NHS for Transwomen. As currently without funding many Transwomen are at risk due to a over masculinized face due to long term Testosterone development to the facial skeleton.
attributes.additional_details:
While the procedure would be aesthetic in nature, it would be in treating this condition to allow Transwomen to live free of anxiety and fear of attack/discrimination in everyday life.

This would parallel chest surgery for Transmen that is currently funded by the NHS.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facial_feminization_surgery

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/gender-dysphoria/treatment/

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/trans-hate-crimes-stats-figures-2017-more-than-third-a8166826.html

attributes.action: The NMC's financial management and cost effectiveness should be reviewed.
attributes.background: It is unclear from NMC annual reports and PSA performance reviews whether the regulator is operating effectively and efficiently from a financial perspective. The public impact and benefits of spending, including capital expenditure and remuneration are unclear using current measures.
attributes.additional_details: During the year 2016/17 the NMC reported £86.155 million in revenue.In 2015/16 revenue totalled £80.265 million. During 2016/17 expenditure totalled £86.646 million. 2015/16 expenditure was £76.344 million. The regulator is generating more revenue and has become more expensive to run. These increases are set within a context of executive resignations, investigations by the Professional Standards Authority and failure in one of the key performance criteria set out by the PSA in 2016/17.

attributes.action: Make The Disability Symbol For Parking/Toilets Inclusive Of Hidden Disability
attributes.background:
Does the government feel that only wheelchair users are classed as disabled when 93% diagnosed with a hidden dissability are blue badge holders?
We propose a change of the current disabled symbol to the universal symbol of a blue circle as an adjustment to reduce prejudice discrimination and stigma
attributes.additional_details:
Most blue badge holders without obvious physical impairment who have parked in wheelchair symbol spaces have experienced animosity and prejudice by members of the public who judge them to be fraudulently taking up the space of 'disabled people' 
As a representative of the charity Epilepsy Sucks UK and mother of a son diagnosed with a severe form of epilepsy and autism who is a blue badge holder I have experienced this myself. 
I urge all with hidden disabilities to sign and state your diagnosis.

attributes.action: Revoke Northern Rail's Charter for disability access failures
attributes.background: Northern Rail fail in their commitments to the Equality Act by treating disabled customers less favourably than non-disabled customers.
attributes.additional_details:
They allow you to book scooter/ramp assistance and then deny access to the train when the customer arrives. This can be intimidating and humiliating them at times.

Northern Rail’s policy is outdated and their treatment of disabled people is unacceptable. The Equality Act 2010 was introduced to help ensure businesses treat everyone fairly. It protects anyone who is disabled, is thought to be disabled, or is with someone who is disabled. It gives these people rights to access goods or services in a way that means they are not treated less favourably than people without a disability

attributes.action: Place ‘not all disabilities and illnesses are visible’ signs on disabled toilets
attributes.background: Those living with unseen disabilities and invisible illnesses can need; and have the right to use, disabled toilet facilities. Yet current signage is not inclusive, overlooks and marginalises those who need to use them, but have no outward or visible indicators of their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The current signage on disabled toilets does not represent our current understanding of hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses; by updating signage on all pre-existing, and all new build disabled toilets we can improve the quality of life for thousands of people around the U.K.  By adding this new signage alongside the pre-existing wheelchair emblem, we both include those living with hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses, and promote equality of toilet access across wider society.

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence to beg or busk with a dog in a public place
attributes.background: Chow dogs are being forced to sit in the heat for over 12 hours as the 'owner' begs for money. Gangs are breeding and importing the dogs for the use of 'entertainment ' to solicit funds. They are 'rented out', forced to urinate tied up, kept in hot vans, beaten and kicked in the head.
attributes.additional_details: Making the use of dogs and other animals for begging and busking a specific offence would make it much easier to bring the perpetrators of this sort of cruelty to justice.

attributes.action: Do not raise fuel duty in the Budget
attributes.background: The Chancellor has indicated he is considering raising fuel duty in the 2018 Autumn Budget. RAC Fuel Watch data shows fuel prices are at their highest for four years with drivers paying £7 more per fill-up on average than 12 months ago and £15 more than in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has the highest duty rate for diesel and the eighth highest for unleaded in the EU. Further increases would put UK drivers and businesses at a bigger disadvantage compared to our European counterparts. Motorists already contribute around £46bn in motoring related taxation each year and higher fuel prices mean the Treasury is already benefiting from extra VAT receipts on fuel costs. 

The Treasury’s own analysis in 2014 showed that lower fuel duty actually boosts economic growth which in turn yields higher revenues from other tax receipts over a long-term period.

We believe the Chancellor risks pushing further economic hardship on motorists for what is an essential item for over 40 million drivers and therefore we call on Philip Hammond to abandon any plans to raise fuel duty.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for nutritional information to be on all food products
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetics require insulin to survive. The dose to be given must be calculated by the carbohydrate amount in food. 

It is currently not a legal requirement to provide this information on unprocessed fruit and vegetables leading to potentially dangerous under/over dosing of insulin.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it an issue? Potatoes contain carbohydrate levels but each variety of potatoes or growing methods can alter the carbohydrate meaning two bags can have big difference in carb values which could lead to the wrong insulin being given.

One popular supermarket routinely does not provide any nutrientional information on their fruit and vegetables.

attributes.action: Implement changes to Student Finance application processing times.
attributes.background:
Many children of EEA Migrant workers risk to drop out of university as a result of delays caused by Student Finance in processing information received. 
 
The procedure can take up to a month and sometimes even more. 
Leaving the students with no financial options and no real time updates.
attributes.additional_details:
We risk to get thrown out/receive severe fines by breaking rental contracts with accommodations and Universities. 
 
Furthermore, go through emotional distress, harming our academics; leading many to drop out. 
 
We demand changes in Student Finance evidence timing process by 
1.Giving real times updates online. 
2.Evidence must be requested at least one month prior the start of term.
 
Additionally, implement a financial system that can sustain the student whilst SFE is dealing with the application.

attributes.action: Seek to extend the A50 period so that there can be a better deal/final vote
attributes.background: The government is making a hash of the Brexit negotiations and needs more time to agree the deal or allow the public a vote on what Brexit could look like in practice.

attributes.action: Make a statement on if there will be an extra £350 million per week for our NHS.
attributes.background:
“We send the EU £350 million a week. Let’s fund our NHS instead.”

A recent study by King's College London has shown that 42% of Britons who had heard of this famous claim still believe it.

We demand the Government indicate whether this shall be the case after leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 the UK Statistics Authority debunked the Vote Leave claim that the UK contributes £350 million to the EU each week, and that this full amount could be spent on the NHS. (https://www.statisticsauthority.gov.uk/news/uk-statistics-authority-statement-on-the-use-of-official-statistics-on-contributions-to-the-european-union/)

Despite this, a recent study by King's College has shown that 42% of Britons who had heard of the claim still believe it. (https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/vote-leave-brexit-lies-eu-pay-money-remain-poll-boris-johnson-a8603646.html)

Therefore, it is important for our democracy that the Government issue a statement to eliminate public confusion over the matter.

attributes.action: Phase out current mental healthcare model and implement the Open Dialogue model.
attributes.background:
Over the next five years:
- Replace open wards with Open Dialogue.
- Reform compulsory detention under the Mental Health Act 1998 in order to fit this method of treatment, as fit.
- Train all mental health staff in Open Dialogue.
- Double MH services that come to the patient’s home “on-call”
attributes.additional_details:
One of the other key point of the Open Dialogue model is it debunks the life-long medication method as it has been proven to be more effective. This should also be reflected in changes in relevant laws.

Changing the mental health act would involve only detaining patients who have broken the law and creating hostels for homeless patients

This investment would ultimately save the taxpayer a lot of money.

Below is a documentary on Open Dialogue:

https://youtu.be/HDVhZHJagfQ

attributes.action: Set up a new homes ombudsman to address serious failings in the building sector.
attributes.background: A new independent ombudsman should have powers to impose large fines to the builders of inadequate new build homes. Failing this the builders should offer a refund to the buyers of substandard homes.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal experience of being sold a substandard home. I was advised by the estate agent that a surveyor was unnecessary as my home carried a 10 year warranty. After a couple of months I appointed a Surveyor due to concerns about the inadequate construction of my home, for example, ordered wardrobes to be fitted, unfortunately these couldn’t be fitted due to the sloping of the floors up to 14ml between one wall and the other.

It is is now nearly 12 months since I moved in - there are 112 defects of which 5 are serious.

attributes.action: Issue a termination notice to Bright Tribe and ALAT multi-academy trusts.
attributes.background: On the 10th of September BBC Panarama aired its findings following investigations into the set up and running of Bright Tribe and ALAT multiacademy Trust’s. Prior to this staff, parents and pupils have highlighted questionable use of related party transactions.
attributes.additional_details: Questions have been raised in the Education Select Committee relating to their conduct. They have already been removed from Whitehaven Academy.

attributes.action: UK adopt a Norway style Brexit. Being in the EFTA-EEA. No jurisdiction for UK.
attributes.background:
The Norway model includes two European organizations.The European Free Trade Association(EFTA) and European Economic Area (EEA)
UK would leave the EU, join EFTA, and become a full member of the EEA.
attributes.additional_details:
Most research suggests this would be the least damaging form of Brexit. The government's own impact assessment found the Norway option would be the least damaging option in terms of economic harm. 
Britain would retain full single market access,it wouldn't be forced to sign up to some of the EU's more contentious policies.
During the 2016 referendum Scotland, Northern Ireland and Gibraltar voted to remain. 
This is the most fair outcome as the UK is still leaving the EU yet keeping access.

attributes.action: Create a veteran status with special benefits
attributes.background:
These benefits are to include: 
A higher tier housing allowance and priority over available homes. 
Food and amenities monthly allowance. 
Free public transport. 
0% Tax on PAYE or anything purchased in the UK. 
0.00 to be paid in council tax upon receiving Veteran status.
attributes.additional_details: Also investment by the government for Veteran communities in the UK, where Veterans can live and support each other, with access to Veteran medical and Dental care, Care workers for the elderly and counselling which is required to have a mandatory 6 monthly or yearly check-up.

attributes.action: Make the DWP form a vulnerability team to support disabled & vulnerable people
attributes.background: Many disabled & vulnerable benefit claimants have problems with their benefits and are left in vulnerable situations, often with no money and no support. We are asking the government to make the DWP form a vulnerable customer team to support disabled & vulnerable claimants requiring urgent help.
attributes.additional_details: I have been working in the world of welfare & benefits advice for 25 years and have seen on a daily basis the difficulties disabled and vulnerable claimants can have with their benefits. Energy companies, water companies and financial services have made great progress providing supportive services for vulnerable customers and I believe it is time that DWP are made to support disabled & vulnerable customers in the same way. The formation of a DWP vulnerable customer team would save lives.

attributes.action: Immediate shut down of oil or gas wells that are cold venting methane gas.
attributes.background: Some UK wells are operating under old style permits which allow them to 'cold' vent methane to the atmosphere if capture or combustion and flaring is technically or economically not viable. Methane is a powerful greenhouse gas and venting is inconsistent with the UK's climate change commitments.
attributes.additional_details: We call for production at these wells to be immediately stopped until they can be adapted to no longer require the use of permitted methane release points.

attributes.action: Fund research and treatment for Neurofibromatosis tumours
attributes.background: It was announced at NF Conference that over half of the patients in the Selumetinib trial saw significant reduction in tumour size of their inoperable plexiform neurofibromas. http://www.ctf.org/news/selumetinib-granted-orphan-drug-designation-by-the-fda-for-nf1 Seeing is believing
attributes.additional_details: My daughter has one in her neck that can’t be removed but has almost killed her a few times and they are others out there. If the result was same in adults, it would save NHS on hospital operations and even hospital stays. There are not enough doctors in UK that know enough about the disorder. We’ve lost friends due to NF and I don’t want my daughter to be just another number. She’s scared it will kill her. She has nightmares.

attributes.action: Workplace Stress&mental health training made mandatory for all managers
attributes.background: Since 2012 work related stress, anxiety & depression has increased from 10.4 million to 12.5 million days lost. Employee, work related mental ill health is taking it's toll on workplaces, but also effecting people's home lives, more often than not alcohol and substance misuse problems, & suicide.
attributes.additional_details: HSEAW states  "Employers have a legal duty to protect employees from stress at work by doing a risk assessment and acting on it." However, as a company who specialise in corporate Mental Health and Workplace Wellbeing programmes the vast majority of organisations we come across are not complying with legislation as legislation is not being enforced, stress Ps & Ps are not in place & managers, HR and H&S have had no training to aid in prevention & appropriate management of these risks.

attributes.action: Change the law on EV charging so people in terraced homes can also benefit
attributes.background: We want EV owners who live in a property without a private driveway or garage to be given the right to install a home charger and run a concealed cable across the pavement outside their home, as well as benefit from the government grant of £500 for installing a domestic charging unit.
attributes.additional_details:
The only way for the UK to reach its targets on air pollution and replacing vehicles that are harming the planet is to give everyone the right to charge their cars at home. There’s a national average of 8 EVs per 1 charging point in the UK. We must do more to encourage home charging. 

Andersen is calling for: 
1.Clarity – force every council to make the rules of on-street home charging clear. 
2.Debate – To find a way forward for on-street home charging to become legal, so drivers can run a concealed cable across the pavement outside their homes. 
3.Fairness – Those installing home chargers for on-street parking receive the same benefits and discounts as those with driveways or garages.

attributes.action: Introduce a Deposit Return system for plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: 1 million bottles are purchased every second. Most are used for less than 30 mins. Less than half are recycled, and each takes 450 years to degrade, with increasing impacts on fossil fuels, the food chain and ecosystems. The UK should follow the lead from other countries.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic pollution is an urgent issue. Plastic production is set to increase rapidly by 2025, and the amount of plastic that can be recycled is very low. Consumers want change, but alternative options are limited.

Deposit schemes have been successful in other countries (e.g Germany, 97% are recycled), and the UK should follow the lead.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 & save £60B+. Improve existing stock instead.
attributes.background: Less money better spent improving existing tracks, rolling stock, etc. HS2 is a vanity project of no benefit except to a few fat cats. Back when it was to be £50B, £5B would have done far better at 1/10 of the cost. Since then, costs are way over original budget.
attributes.additional_details: The Government currently say HS2 will cost £55.7 billion to build. The costs originally started at £32.7bn in 2010. The National Audit Office stated in 2016 that HS2 was running £7bn over budget, a fact not contested by HS2.

attributes.action: CANZUK: Join the Trans-Tasman Travel Arrangement
attributes.background: We would like the UK government to formally begin talks with the Canadian, Australian and New Zealand governments to allow for the accession of the UK and Canada into the Trans-Tasman Travel Arrangement.
attributes.additional_details:
Subject to strict criminal and healthcare checks, this would allow free trade, freedom of movement, reciprocal healthcare and visa free labour for citizens including retirement location between the four nations. No benefits claims can be made for expats until 2 years residency.

The 4 governments and their opposition parties, have all committed to fostering deeper ties. This idea has been consistently polled to show strong support, amongst the general public, in all regions of the 4 nations.

attributes.action: Pledge 5% of the UK's annual GDP to halt climate change
attributes.background: By heavily investing in green technologies, research and infrastructure within the UK now, this government would assure the industrial sector for the UK would become the preeminent leader in all green technologies before the rest of the world inevitably takes similar measures.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45084144

attributes.action: Allow parents to claim carers allowance for more than one child who receive DLA
attributes.background: I am a mother of 2 disabled children. They both are in reciept of high rate DLA and mobility. Therefore I claim carers allowance of £64.60 a week which is way below the national minimum wage. One of my children has various complex medical neeeds and is a full on 24/7 365 days a week nursing role.
attributes.additional_details: As parents and full time carers to our children, most of us can not work due to the complex nature of our children’s medical needs. Therefore I am calling on our government to enable us full time parent carers of more than one disabled child to be able to claim the £64.60 per week for each of our children who are in receipt of DLA and not just one.

attributes.action: Change adultery for grounds of divorce to apply to same-sex affairs
attributes.background: According to current UK law, you cannot divorce someone on grounds of adultery if it's a same-sex affair. This technically means that you don't legally commit adultery if you cheat on your partner with someone of the same sex- even if you are in a same-sex marriage. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: In order for heterosexual and homosexual couples to have completely equal rights, the UK law needs to change urgently.

attributes.action: Change Child Benefit cap from £60k sole earner to £100k joint or single income
attributes.background: The rules introduced in 2012 that child benefit should be capped at £60,000 are fundementally flawed. A single income of £60,000 means that you are not entitled to any child benefit yet 2 parents working can earn £98,000 and get the full entitlement.
attributes.additional_details: A single earner of £60k will be on a 40% tax bracket with no child benefit yet 2 parents can earn £43k each at 20% and get full child benefit. Families work extremely hard to enable one of the parents to look after their children during their youngest years rather than a stranger but the government seems to want to make this extremely difficult. There is also very little public Information to inform you that you lose this when you hit £60k meaning you end up in debt to the inland revenue.

attributes.action: Make flu jabs free for teachers
attributes.background: Flu jabs are free for a range of different people, teachers come into contact with a large number of people including children and parents. Schools often have flu outbreaks and teachers end up having to take time off due to sickness. This could be prevented if flu jabs were provided.

attributes.action: Have another general election
attributes.background: The government is dysfunctional. Current policies ranging from Universal Credit, NHS social care to Brexit are causing great dismay. This country deserves better. The government refuses to contribute to parliamentary votes, uses filibustering tactics and lacks transparency. This is not democracy.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the death penalty and make life sentences actually life.
attributes.background: Reintroduce the death penalty for evil and callous crimes. Make life sentences actually life behind bars, for example an 80 year sentence. This way we can protect the public and save lives.

attributes.action: Make therapies (DBT) and help more accessible to individuals with BPD
attributes.background: As an individual who has been failed by the NHS over treatment regarding BPD, I want to get the government to realise how big of an issue this is. Statistics show suicide rates are higher in individuals with BPD than the average individual. Please help us and sign this petition.
attributes.additional_details: Around 9 percent of people with BPD complete suicide, which is more than 50 times the rate of suicide in the general population. Almost 80% of those with BPD report a history of suicide attempts.

attributes.action: Make maintenance loans proportionate to the average living costs in the area
attributes.background: Maintenance loans should be made proportionate to average costs in the area of study in order to help students living in more expensive areas be able to complete their degree without worrying about struggling to afford rent/food/bills etc. Maintenance loan is often not enough to cover students.
attributes.additional_details: Maintenance loan is currently proportionate to your families income, with the exception of studying in London which takes into account the higher prices. However, there are places such as Brighton which is also a very expensive place to live. Someone studying in Brighton will struggle to live off their maintenance loan compare to someone with the same maintenance loan in somewhere such as Leeds. This puts the person studying in Brighton in a difficult position to come up with additional funds

attributes.action: Please do not increase the IHS paid by migrants coming to the UK to £400.
attributes.background: Please do not increase the IHS paid by migrants coming to the UK to £400. its unfair it has to be paid on the second 2.5 year spouse visa WHICH PARTNERS ARE already paying towards the nhs through national insurance and tax through jobs so its unfair they have to pay extra nhs money

attributes.action: Make all BBC board of directors all subject to election by UK electorate
attributes.background: To ensure those in ultimate charge of BBC ensure what it broadcasts or publishes is genuinely unbiased have a board of directors that is periodically subject to election by proportional representation by the general UK electorate

attributes.action: Remove Abellio Greater Anglia from servicing the Greater Anglia rail network.
attributes.background: The Abellio Greater Anglia service worsens on a monthly basis, all the while annually raising rail fares inexplicably. Cancellations, regularly late running trains, reduced carriages, overcrowding, extortionate fares. No remorse for their customers & no sign of reinvestment in the service. Get rid!
attributes.additional_details:
I am lucky if my daily commute from Bishop's Stortford to London is ever on time or disrupted in one way or another. I pay approximately  £500 a month, or £6,000 for a service which is miles away from being worth it, but I am left with little option to get to work each day (if I'm lucky).

Fares have beeing increased nearly 10% in the last 4 years and there have been no improvements made. Broken down trains which don't get replaced. Trains are late EVERY DAY. Trains are overcrowded.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people convicted of murder.
attributes.background: People convicted of murder should face the death penalty.

attributes.action: Incentivise the use of the river Thames as a transport mode for freight
attributes.background:
Having operated vessels on the Thames, I am saddened by the surrounding decline of practical opportunities for utilising our glorious river sustainably for freight.

We must ask government to assess whether enough resource is available for industry to thrive and prefer water transport over road.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, yet again commuters using the M25 are stranded due to a HGV freight collision closing the QEII bridge.
Whilst this may seem unrelated, our small vessels pass underneath, with nearly no other vessels in site for miles.
A free, reliable transport mode able to move thousands of tonnes a day and relieve the neighbouring roads of HGV movements.
Why is more not being done to retain the use of the waterways?  Shipyards are in decline.  Skills are in decline.  We must act, before it is too late

attributes.action: The UK should create a Blockchain Act to support the new tokenized economy
attributes.background: Our legal infrastructure needs to provide a foundation for proper digital signing with private keys, and support the legal consequences of the ownership, possession and transfer of tokens.
attributes.additional_details:
A Blockchain Act will support the new tokenized economy, and where real-world applications around blockchain can be enacted with legal certainty. These tokens include: payment tokens (currency coins); utility tokens (services); and security tokens (equity and assets). 

Liechtenstein's Blockchain Act defines its objective as to:

"enable the transformation of the ‘real’ world to blockchain systems while ensuring legal certainty, thereby opening up the full application potential of the token economy."

The UK Act should aim to define “legal certainty” for blockchain implementation and projects, and define a world where our existing assets are added onto blockchain, and then traded there.

attributes.action: Stop uninsured drivers by increasing fines to £1000+
attributes.background:
In March 2018 we were hit by an uninsured driver. I was left with 7 broken bones, an operation, 7 days in hospital and the ongoing prospect of an 18 month recovery period.

The magistrates have banned the driver for 6 months and fined them just £120 for this offence.
attributes.additional_details: I ask for your support to get the Government to review the current fines imposed to be more reflective of the crime. £120 is less than the cost of most insurance cover and therefore not a deterrent. I propose a minimum fine of £1000+ to stop people driving without insurance.

attributes.action: A short stay disability parking pass for people urgently needing toilet access
attributes.background: 100,000’s people in the UK have bowel or bladder condition which means they urgently have to use a toilet.  Sufferers often don’t make it to a toilet in time due to not being able to park in an accessible parking spot because they do not qualify for a disabled car parking badge.
attributes.additional_details:
Sufferers would only need to use the parking pass for the time when they urgently need a toilet.  They would then be able to move their vehicle to a standard parking spot.

Having a short stay pass for those times when they suddenly need access to a toilet would significantly improve the independence & quality of life for a person living with a long term bowel or bladder condition that affects their levels of continence.

attributes.action: Tax manufacturers and suppliers distributing Single Use Plastics beyond 2020
attributes.background: Following the success of documentaries such as Blue Planet, it has become clearer the deadly state single use plastics has on our environment. The government should look at taxing the problem at source to encourage companies to research breakthrough in sustainable, biodegradable alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.plasticfreechallenge.org/what-is-single-use-plastic/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-45232167

https://ieep.eu/archive_uploads/2128/IEEP_ACES_Product_Fiche_Single_Use_Plastics_Final_October_2016.pdf

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.radiotimes.com/news/tv/2018-08-29/blue-planet-2-plastic-waste-final-episode/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/abcnews.go.com/amp/International/great-pacific-garbage-patch-massive-floating-island-plastic/story%3fid=53962147

attributes.action: Make cyclists have a registration plate, tax, Mot and insurance
attributes.background: We have been getting very heated with each other over push bikers. As if they crash into you and then they ride off there would be no proof of it or any way to prosecute them.

attributes.action: Stop the slaughtering of farmed animals for human consumption.
attributes.background: Animals are forcibly impregnated, kept in closed and confined spaces, stunned (although in some cases like Halal slaughterhouses they are not stunned) and slaughtered.
